articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Gaza has become a "mass grave" for Palestinians and those trying to help them, medical charity MSF said on Wednesday, as medics said the Israeli military killed at least 13 in the north of the enclave and continued to demolish homes in Rafah in the south.
articles.title: Gaza a 'mass grave' of Palestinians, says MSF, as Israeli strikes kill 13

articles.author: Ernest Scheyder, Costas Pitas
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday ordered a probe into potential new tariffs on all U.S. critical minerals imports, a major escalation in his dispute with global trade partners and an attempt to push back on industry leader China.
articles.title: Trump orders tariff probe on all US critical mineral imports

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny, David Ljunggren, Wa Lone
articles.description: For someone trying to win an election, Mark Carney appeared taken aback by the crowd of about 300 chanting his name at a meet-and-greet in this steel town menaced by tariffs.
articles.title: Mark Carney talks tough on Trump ahead of Canada election

articles.author: Sam Tobin, Michael Holden
articles.description: The United Kingdom's top court on Wednesday upheld an appeal by a campaign group on whether transgender women are legally women under equality legislation, ruling that the law referred to a "biological woman and biological sex".
articles.title: UK Supreme Court says 'woman' refers to biological sex under equality laws

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's overnight drone attack on the Black Sea port city of Odesa damaged residential buildings, warehouses and civilian infrastructure, Ukrainian officials from the region said early on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russian drone attack on Odesa damages homes, civilian infrastructure, Ukraine says

articles.author: Daniel Leussink, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Japan is set to begin tariff negotiations with the United States in Washington on Wednesday, one of the first countries to test President Donald Trump's willingness to relent on sweeping import duties that have roiled markets and stoked recession fears.
articles.title: Japan set to kick off Trump tariff talks in Washington

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Arien Stojanovic Ivkovic, 31, a Croatian doctor who lives in Belgrade with her Serbian husband and a three-year-old daughter, was given one week's notice to leave the country last week and told she was a security threat.
articles.title: Serbia expels Croatian doctor married to Serb over security threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Al Shabaab fighters attacked a town in central Somalia on Wednesday that government forces have been using as a staging area for their efforts to drive back the militants, who have been gaining ground in recent weeks, residents said.
articles.title: Al Shabaab attacks strategic Somalia town as it presses offensive

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is looming large in the final weeks of Australia's general election campaign, spelling trouble for conservative opposition leader Peter Dutton just as a new poll shows Australians' faith in the United States at an all-time low.
articles.title: Trump trips up Australia's conservative opposition in election's last laps

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Finland said on Wednesday it had decided to keep its eastern border against neighbouring Russia closed until further notice.
articles.title: Finland to keep Russia border closed until further notice
